intro: Podolepis neglecta, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, while its flowers range in color from white to pale blue. Podolepis neglecta is often found in montane regions and is adapted to cooler, humid climates.
